intro: Astracantha alexandri, commonly known as the Alexandrian star-thistle, is a perennial flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves with serrated edges. Its flowers are usually purple to pink in color, blooming from late spring to early autumn. Astracantha alexandri is known for its ability to thrive in dry, rocky soils and is often found in disturbed habitats.
